title: Python Learning Track
description: Beginner-friendly programming material used during Wednesday meets. Covers fundamentals needed for scripting, CTF tooling, automation, and basic cybersecurity workflows.

title: Python for Hackers (Automate Tasks & Security Scripts)
description: A curated collection of practical Python tutorials focusing on file handling, requests, subprocess, parsing logs, and writing automation scripts relevant to cybersecurity.

title: TryHackMe: Complete Beginner Path
description: A structured entry-level pathway used during Cybersoc’s semester-long CTF series. Builds strong fundamentals in recon, OSINT, file forensics, basic web vulns, and Linux navigation.

title: TryHackMe: Web Fundamentals
description: A pathway to web application security. Understand web fundamentals; Major vulnerabilities explained; Learn industry-used tools; Web application assessments.

title: Reverse Engineering Starter Pack
description: Beginner-friendly learning resources aligning with Cybersoc’s reverse-engineering work during Game Off collaborations. Includes Ghidra basics, binaries, strings, and code flow analysis.

title: Basic Malware Analysis Lab
description: Intro to malware analysis concepts used during advanced meets. Covers static analysis, strings, unpacking basics, and safe lab setup with VM isolation.

title: OSINT Framework
description: A huge collection of tools used for Open-Source Intelligence tasks: username enumeration, metadata extraction, social footprints, recon & investigation.

title: Cybersecurity Career Roadmap
description: A practical breakdown of cybersecurity domains: SOC analysis, SIEM tools, incident response, network monitoring, scripting, and blue-team operations. Helps beginners understand the industry.

title: Intro to SIEM & Blue Team Ops
description: Hands-on labs covering SIEM concepts, log analysis, blue-team workflows, threat detection, and incident investigation.

title: Game Development Resources (Game Off Collaboration)
description: Tools, asset repositories, and engines used during the Game Off 2025 collaboration between Cybersoc, CompSci, and DataSci. Tailored for secure coding and RE-friendly workflows.
